persona.name: Micah Elise Santiago-Ramirez

occupation.title: Freelance Graphic Designer / Unemployed Student
occupation.description: Micah takes on occasional freelance gigs designing flyers, social media graphics, and zines for local activist groups, small businesses, and friends. Most work is unpaid or low-paid, often exchanged for favors or community support. Micah is not currently enrolled in school or employed in a traditional job, and spends significant time searching for opportunities, applying for jobs, and working on personal creative projects. Skills include proficiency in Canva, basic Adobe Photoshop, and social media content creation. Micah also volunteers as a social media manager for a local mutual aid collective.

education.details: Attended Harold Washington College in Chicago, majoring in Media Arts and Journalism. Completed two years before pausing studies due to financial constraints. Participated in student-run radio and the campus LGBTQ+ alliance. High school diploma from Roberto Clemente Community Academy, where Micah was active in the art club and debate team.

long_term_goals: To complete a college degree in Media Arts or Graphic Design and secure stable, meaningful employment.
To use creative skills to amplify marginalized voices, especially within the Black and Latinx LGBTQ+ communities.
To achieve financial independence and be able to support their mother and younger sibling.
To travel outside the U.S., especially to Puerto Rico and Europe, and connect with extended family.
To maintain good physical and mental health, overcoming chronic conditions and building sustainable habits.
To contribute to social justice movements, particularly around racial equity, climate action, and universal healthcare.
To publish a graphic novel or zine that reflects their hybrid cultural identity.
To foster a supportive, chosen family and deepen connections with friends.
To eventually have a safe, comfortable home in a diverse, urban neighborhood.
To learn Spanish fluently and reconnect with Puerto Rican heritage.

style.speech: Micah speaks with a Chicago urban accent, code-switching between African American Vernacular English (AAVE), Spanglish, and standard American English depending on context. Their speech is expressive, peppered with slang, memes, and references to internet culture. They are informal, sometimes irreverent, and use humor or sarcasm to deflect discomfort. When passionate, their voice becomes animated and fast-paced. They are careful to use inclusive language and correct pronouns, and are quick to call out microaggressions.
style.appearance: Micah favors comfort and self-expression: oversized hoodies, thrifted graphic tees, joggers or leggings, and well-worn running shoes. They often wear a beanie or headwrap, and accessorize with enamel pins, pride flags, and handmade jewelry. Tattoos and piercings are visible. Their running gear is basic but functional—old but reliable sneakers, moisture-wicking shirts, and a reflective armband for night jogs.
style.mannerisms: Micah gestures with their hands when speaking, fidgets with rings or hoodie strings, and often doodles in a sketchbook during downtime. They avoid eye contact when anxious, but are animated and expressive with friends. They slouch when sitting, and walk with a slight bounce.
style.social presence: Active on Twitter, Instagram, and TikTok, where they post memes, art, and commentary on social issues. They are more confident online than in person, and use digital spaces to build community.

traits: Highly open to new experiences: loves trying new foods, exploring subcultures, and experimenting with art styles.
Creative and imaginative, often daydreams or gets lost in personal projects.
Disorganized and struggles with time management; frequently procrastinates and misses deadlines.
Empathetic and sensitive to others' emotions, but can be moody and withdrawn under stress.
Spontaneous, sometimes impulsive, and enjoys last-minute adventures.
Distrustful of authority and skeptical of institutions; values authenticity and transparency.
Loyal to friends and chosen family, but slow to trust new people.
Prone to anxiety and self-doubt, especially regarding finances and future prospects.
Enjoys humor, irony, and satire; uses jokes to cope with discomfort.
Values diversity and inclusivity, and is quick to defend marginalized groups.
Can be stubborn and resistant to advice, especially from perceived 'elites' or establishment figures.
Tends to avoid conflict but will stand up for core values when pushed.

big_five.openness: Very high—Micah is curious, imaginative, and always seeking new experiences.
big_five.conscientiousness: Low—struggles with organization, planning, and follow-through.
big_five.extraversion: Moderate—enjoys socializing in small, trusted groups but is drained by large crowds.
big_five.agreeableness: High—empathetic, cooperative, and values harmony, though can be blunt when passionate.
big_five.neuroticism: High—prone to anxiety, mood swings, and stress-related behaviors.

Streetwear fashion: thrifts for unique pieces, customizes jackets and sneakers.
Anime and manga: favorites include Attack on Titan, Mob Psycho 100, and indie webcomics.

Streaming shows with strong queer or POC leads.
dislikes: Being pressured to 'just get a job.'

Does not view inflation as a major issue compared to systemic inequality.
Believes the U.S. is on the wrong track, especially regarding economic and racial justice.
Feels the family’s financial situation is worse than four years ago.
Experiences moderate hardship due to inflation, but sees structural issues as more pressing.
Disapproves of the current Supreme Court and sees it as out of touch.
Believes U.S. support for Israel is too strong and not aligned with human rights.

health.physical: Average health with some chronic issues: mild hypertension, borderline obesity, and occasional joint pain from running. Takes care to stretch and avoid overexertion. Eats a mostly vegan diet, sometimes struggles with iron deficiency.
health.mental: Struggles with chronic insomnia and anxiety, especially related to finances and future uncertainty. Attends therapy when affordable. Uses running, art, and social media as coping mechanisms. Occasionally experiences depressive episodes, especially during winter.
health.medical_history: Diagnosed with mild hypertension at 20. History of iron deficiency anemia. No major injuries, but has experienced shin splints from running. Family history of diabetes and heart disease.

family.description: Single parent, works two jobs, close but sometimes strained relationship due to financial stress. Micah helps with household chores and supports emotionally.
High school student, looks up to Micah, shares interests in art and gaming. They bond over anime and vegan cooking.
Minimal contact, lives in New York. Occasional texts but little emotional connection.
Puerto Rican relatives in New York and on the island; occasional video calls, language barrier due to limited Spanish.

other_facts: Micah was born and raised in Humboldt Park, Chicago, a neighborhood with a strong Puerto Rican and Black community presence.
They grew up celebrating both Black History Month and Three Kings Day, blending traditions from both sides of the family.
Micah’s first language was English, but they picked up some Spanish from their abuela and community events.
They have a tattoo of the Puerto Rican flag and a Black power fist on their forearm.
Micah’s favorite childhood memory is dancing bomba with their cousins at a family reunion.
They once organized a pop-up art show in an abandoned storefront, featuring work from local queer artists.
Micah’s first zine, 'Hybrid,' explored their experiences as a multiracial, non-binary person in Chicago.
They have struggled with food insecurity, sometimes skipping meals to help their sibling eat.
Micah’s running route includes a stretch along the 606 trail, where they stop to photograph murals.
They have a collection of enamel pins representing different causes: Black Lives Matter, trans pride, veganism, and more.
Micah’s favorite board game is 'Root,' and they often play as the Vagabond.
They once cosplayed as a gender-bent Miles Morales at C2E2, winning a small prize.
Micah’s first job was at a vegan bakery, where they learned to make plant-based pastries.
They have a habit of doodling on every available surface, including receipts and napkins.
Micah’s favorite comfort food is vegan mofongo, which they learned to make from YouTube.
They have a complicated relationship with their father, who left when they were 10.
Micah’s mother is their biggest supporter, but they often argue about money and the future.
They have experienced discrimination for being non-binary and multiracial, especially in school.
Micah’s favorite place to relax is the Garfield Park Conservatory.
They once spent a night in a police holding cell after being arrested at a protest.
Micah’s dream is to visit San Juan and see the murals in Santurce.
They have a playlist for every mood, including 'Run Away' for jogging and 'Chill Vibes' for drawing.
Micah’s favorite artist is Jean-Michel Basquiat.
They have a small but growing collection of houseplants, most of which are named after anime characters.
Micah’s favorite meme is the 'Distracted Boyfriend,' which they have remixed for zines.
They have a recurring nightmare about being lost in a maze of subway tunnels.
Micah’s favorite season is fall, when the city feels alive with festivals and art events.
They once lost a sketchbook full of personal art on the L train and still think about it.
Micah’s favorite thrift store is Village Discount Outlet on Milwaukee Ave.
They have a scar on their knee from a childhood bike accident.
Micah’s favorite way to decompress is a hot shower with scented candles.
They have a complicated relationship with religion: raised Catholic, now unaffiliated but interested in Afro-Caribbean spiritual practices.
Micah’s favorite quote is 'We are the ones we’ve been waiting for.'
They have a habit of collecting buttons and stickers from every event they attend.
Micah’s favorite animal is the capybara, which they consider their 'spirit animal.'
They once spent a summer volunteering at a community garden, learning about urban agriculture.
Micah’s favorite holiday is Halloween, for the costumes and sense of community.
They have a soft spot for cheesy 90s cartoons and often rewatch them for nostalgia.
Micah’s biggest fear is being forgotten or leaving no impact.
They keep a journal of dreams and ideas for future art projects.
